meanings.definition: The act of giving birth to lambs.
meanings.sent1: During the lambing, the ewe welcomed her newborn lamb.
meanings.sent2: The farmer assisted the sheep during the lambing process.
meanings.sent3: The lambing season brought joy to the farm with new fluffy arrivals.
meanings.sent4: The fields were filled with the sounds of lambing, a symphony of new life.
meanings.sent5: The lambing was a beautiful sight, a miracle of nature unfolding before our eyes.

meanings.definition: The season during which sheep give birth to lambs.
meanings.sent1: Spring is the lambing when the fields are dotted with newborn lambs.
meanings.sent2: The lambing is a busy time for the farmers as they care for the pregnant ewes.
meanings.sent3: The children eagerly awaited the lambing, hoping to see the baby lambs.
meanings.sent4: The lambing season painted the countryside in shades of white and black.
meanings.sent5: The farm was alive with activity during the lambing, a time of new beginnings.
